units.title: Initiate monolayer culture from MEF‑grown hPSCs
units.text: Obtain a six-well plate of high-quality hPSCs grown on MEFs (~80% conﬂuency) in standard hPSC culture medium containing 20% KnockOut Serum Replacement (Fig. 3a). Aspirate the medium and wash with 3 mL of PBS w/o. Add 500 μL of Accutase, and place the plate into a humidiﬁed incubator at 37 °C for 3 min. Add 3 mL of DMEM/F12, and disperse the colonies into single cells by pipetting until all cells are detached. Transfer the cell suspension to a 15 mL conical tube, and centrifuge at 300g for 3 min at 4 °C. Remove the supernatant, and gently resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Take a prepared Geltrex-coated T25 ﬂask, aspirate the medium and add 4 mL E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Transfer the cell suspension from step (v) to the T25 ﬂask, and place the ﬂask into the incubator. Move the ﬂask a few times back and forth and left to right at the point where it is placed in the incubator to ensure that the cells are equally distributed (Supplementary Video 1). Change the medium after 2 d and then daily by aspirating the medium and adding 5 mL of fresh E8. When the cells are conﬂuent, proceed to the next step.
units.rationale: Establishes a monolayer of hPSCs on Geltrex for downstream differentiation.

units.title: Initiate monolayer culture from frozen hPSC stock
units.text: Obtain a frozen vial of high-quality hPSCs established from prior monolayer culture. Our frozen vials usually contain 3 × 10^6 hPSCs. Prepare a 15 mL conical tube with 10 mL cold (4 °C) DMEM/F12, and transfer the content of the vial into the conical tube. Centrifuge the conical tube at 300g for 3 min at 4 °C. Remove the supernatant, and resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Take a prepared Geltrex-coated T25 ﬂask, aspirate the medium and add 4 mL E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Transfer the cell suspension from (iv) to the T25 ﬂask, and place the ﬂask into the incubator. Move the ﬂask a few times back and forth and left to right at the point where it is placed in the incubator to ensure that the cells are equally distributed (Supplementary Video 1). Change the medium after 2 d and then daily by aspirating the medium and adding 5 mL of fresh E8. When the cells are conﬂuent, proceed to the next step.
units.rationale: Provides a rapid way to start monolayer cultures from cryopreserved cells.

units.title: Passage hPSCs in monolayer culture
units.text: Take the conﬂuent T25 ﬂask (Fig. 3b; conﬂuency is typically reached 2–4 d after seeding), aspirate the medium and add 5 mL of PBS w/o. Aspirate the PBS w/o, add 1 mL of Accutase and place the plate into the incubator. Add 5 mL of DMEM/F12 to the ﬂask, and rinse the ﬂask bottom with the medium to detach the cells. Transfer the resulting cell suspension to a 15 mL conical tube, and centrifuge the tube at 300g for 3 min at 4 °C. Remove the supernatant, and gently resuspend the cell pellet in 1 mL of E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Count the cells and assess the cell viability by applying Trypan blue staining in a hemocytometer using standard methods (and previously described33). Take a prepared Geltrex-coated T25 ﬂask, aspirate the medium and add 5 mL E8 + 10 μM Y27632. Add 0.5–1.0 × 10^6 cells to the ﬂask, and place it into the incubator. Move the ﬂask a few times back and forth and left to right at the point where it is placed in the incubator to ensure that the cells are equally distributed (Supplementary Video 1). Change the medium after 2 d and then daily by aspirating the medium and adding 5 mL of fresh E8 (Y27632 is only required for cell seeding and so is not needed). After 3–4 d, the hPSCs will have formed a conﬂuent monolayer; passage again by repeating Steps 2–8.
units.rationale: Maintains healthy, confluent monolayers and prepares cells for differentiation.

units.title: Seed hPSCs and form aggregates for HFOs (day ‑4)
units.text: Seed 100 µL of the stock cell suspension per well of a U-shaped ultra-low attachment 96-well plate. Seed 12 wells (one row) more than the number of desired HFOs (Table 1). Centrifuge the plate at 300g and 4 °C for 3 min to bring the cells to the culture plate bottom, and place the plate into the incubator.
units.rationale: Creates uniform cell aggregates that will develop into heart field organoids.

units.title: Matrigel embedding of hPSC aggregates (day ‑2)
units.text: Two days after seeding (d-2), the hPSC aggregates are embedded in Matrigel droplets. Before you start, take out the required amount of Matrigel aliquots from the freezer and let them thaw on ice. When the Matrigel is thawed, insert the aliquots into the ice. Take out the sterile scissors (heated to at least 180 °C for at least 3 h), and let them cool down at room temperature. ... Afterward, place the plate into the incubator for 50–60 min to let the Matrigel solidify. Add 100 µL E8 per well. A multichannel pipet can be used in this step. Add the medium slowly and carefully, depressing the plunger of the pipet only until the first stop to prevent damage and floating of the Matrigel droplets. Place the plate back into the incubator.
units.rationale: Stabilizes aggregates in a 3‑D matrix to support subsequent cardiac differentiation.

units.title: CHIR/IWP2 differentiation of HFOs (d0‑d7)
units.text: Two days after embedding aggregates (d0), differentiation of the hPSC aggregates is initiated. Remove the culture medium from the wells without aspirating or damaging the Matrigel droplets with the aggregates.
units.rationale: Starts the timed WNT activation/inhibition sequence that drives cardiac lineage specification.

units.title: Prepare CHIR99021 working solution
units.text: Prepare the working solution (7.5 µM) by dissolving 0.625 μL of the stock solution per 1 mL of culture medium.
units.rationale: Ensures accurate CHIR concentration for the differentiation steps.

units.title: Prepare Y27632 working solution
units.text: Prepare the working solution (10 µM) by dissolving 1 μL of the stock solution per 1 mL of culture medium.
units.rationale: Provides the ROCK inhibitor needed for cell survival during seeding.

units.title: Geltrex coating of T25 flasks
units.text: Dissolve 125 μL of frozen Geltrex in 50 mL of cold (directly from the refrigerator, ~4 °C) DMEM/F12. Add 5 mL of the solution per T25 ﬂask, and incubate the ﬂasks for 1 h at 37 °C in a humidiﬁed incubator. The Geltrex-coated ﬂasks can be stored at 4 °C for up to 4 weeks.
units.rationale: Creates a defined extracellular matrix surface for hPSC attachment and growth.

units.title: Prepare RB− medium
units.text: Add 1 mL of B27 supplement minus insulin to 50 mL of RPMI 1640 medium. The medium can be stored at 4 °C for up to 1 month. The medium may be supplemented with 10 μL of penicillin/streptomycin per 1 mL of culture medium.
units.rationale: Provides the basal medium used for later stages of organoid culture.
